comments.body: Shulkers are an Ender mob, and Arthropods means that rhe mob should be an insect, spider, crustacean. Shulkers are inspired to molluscs, so they can't be classified as arthropods

contrary to what the person above me has said, I'd argue Shulkers are close enough to fitting the requirements. Some minor research led me to find that all Arthropods have the following features:

  • No Spinal Column
  • An Exoskeleton
  • Bi-Lateral Symmetry
  • Jointed Appendages
  • Segmented Bodies
  • Specialised Appendages

Shulkers do not possess a Spine, I would argue their shell can count as an Exoskeleton, they absolutely have Bilateral Symmetry, I would say their disconnected shells and head count for Segmented Bodies, and- the Specialised Appendages point is hard to argue for, but you could argue say their top shell that functions to hide and reveal themselves counts? Or the bottom shell that keeps them attached to their block.

And in the end, I do not believe it needs to line up 100%. After looking into it, it does seem to line up with the Mollusca Phylum much better than the Arthropoda, but currently Bane of Arthropods is kind of lacking a single niche use-case that would make it worth using.

Generally if you are encountering nearly any mob of the Arthropoda Phylum in Minecraft, they're spiders, in which case there are other mobs around too

Silverfish, which arguably could almost be a good reason to have a sword on hand? but even in mountains barely have a noteworthy presence

Bees, why would you need a dedicated sword to kill bees?

Cave Spiders, again, there are other mobs to worry about in Mineshafts

Endermites- again, way too niche to every be handy

Shulkers would give it a use-case for endbusting
i would not have polar bears be hostile (maybe it could be like a smaller yeti) and have it naturally spawn, but is is a great idea

The Yeti could have frost particles whenever it moves or attacks. I think the idea of it summoning mobs is too overpowered but I love how it could smash the ground. Another attack to knock back the player would be a slap.

I feel like a Yeti is a force of nature and should naturally spawn rarely on snowy Mountains or ice plains. It would have two brown horns, blue eyes, very hairy, white, big, and intimidating.

A cool detail to features is that sometimes it will pick up snow blocks, perhaps throw snowballs, sleep as an idle animation or scare other mobs away
Called crystals not amethyst
This sounds good for story maps but they glow squid should have this and a bit more

I was thinking they could drop glow stone dust. I know you can already get that from witches, but that’s the first thing I thought of when I heard the name. I think it would make the spawning of sea creatures in your guardian farm less annoying. It might just be me, but my guardian farm storage gets chests full of inc sacs. Having glow squids drop glow stone would mean people could get more useful mob drops from guardian farms, even if unintentionally.
Maybe not a new material but soul fire torch

Yeah I actually agree with this. I agree with this because the drowneds are two common, if you think about it in the over world we have zombies, skeletons, spiders, creepers e.g. why not have more variety of underwater hostile mobs, mob A was cool but I don’t think they will add it back :(.
Minecraft waters desperately need a new hostile mob, Drowned is really the only thing I'm fighting, and it gets boring. Why get an Axolotl army if that's all you're fighting?
And spiders should be able to leave cob webs in certain areas at certain times. It could make for a spawn-independant string farm, too.

They definitely need an update! They should also get the same abilities on bedrock that they have on Java. I think it would be cool if in future updates, they looked at spiders in respect to the nearly useless bane of athropods achievement. They are easy enough to eliminate without this enchantment and pose very little risks to the player. Perhaps more athropods/spiders + a more threatening spider in general could add a reason to get bane of athropods. The vertical climbing idea and suspending would be so cool to see in game.
Great idea! :)
There could even be a whole biome full of spiders, making bane of arthropods worth having in that particular biome.

Sorry, but this may not be possible without commands. By the time you locate all the creatures, new ones will likely have spawned. The /kill @e or /kill @a commands can get rid of all of them, but to unlock commands you need to disable achievements in that world.

nekos are mostly in hentai...

Not sure where you're getting that statistic(?) tre3meow, but ok.

This is an idea, although it might be a better idea to not just name them the japanese word for "cat"?

This is Minecraft, after all; not an anime MMORPG outright.
How about calling them "Felidians"? They could use bows and stone swords. Perhaps they could have a skeletal form (similar to Zombie Piglins) that only utilize a new, special kind of bow: the Blackstone Bow, which could have very quick but weak shots.

And to build on the "cat-tail camps", what if they had their own sort of villages that centered around structures resembling that of Jungle Temples? Maybe these creatures are evolved Ocelots? Mystery is a key factor here.

@tazwonderosity, you have quite the Interesting take for my Idea, as nekos are kinda generic despite not being true to their Japanese mythos. I’d say we’d mix the designs between our Ideas. But tre3cat, that was a rather weird flex considering I was basing them off of 10% anime and 90% Japanese mythos, We could make many paths to contrast these Minecraft bakenekos and nekomatas with their anime counterparts and grow closer to their Japanese mythos. I thought the anime design would give them a cute look despite not being the wholesome cats they should be. Overall, nice Idea
As they aren't illagers (assuming they do not resemble villagers) they should not be hostile to villagers, or if they are, they should also be hostile to illagers.

So here Is a list of variables the neko mobs could have...

 

First off, they despise piglins, and thus will attempt to use their arsenal to strike them down. However, They are obsessed with two things - quartz and lanterns. Giving a bakeneko who's without their fellow felines will actually tame them. If a neko sees a lantern (be It a nekomata, bakeneko, nekomancer, or the felidians, who could be the 4th and most unique variation, as they are more like ocelots then normal cats..) they will steal It, emitting a satisfied "meow" upon doing so.

 

Each neko type has a set of weapons to choose from. Bakenekos prefer swords or sometimes bows, while nekomatas carry crossbows and sometimes ballistas, a stronger yet slower varient of the crossbow. Felidians could obviously be reliant on blackstone bows and spears, a new type of poking weapon that also exists as a progression weapon, much like the axe and sword, albeit It Isn't as powerful as the trident.

 

They have 3 structures: Blackstone towers and cat-tail camps. Felidians prefer to remain in the towers while their more refined relatives remain In the camps. Sometimes you'll see a large tower surrounded by camps, this Is a besalt pagoda, and Is home to the nekomancer, a new nether mini-boss or even a nether boss.
basically pigi dudes that are in bastions

Honestly this suggestion had a lot of potential (I say being the former creator of this).

Although there isn't any opposition, the piglins already sort of have hold a gap between villagers and illagers as mobs, but some originality thrown in, Nekomatas/Bakenekos/Felidians, the idea could definitely go places.
you should be able to it your tools if needed since they use sticks and they cause the dog to do whatever the is used for like attacking, mining,gardening, etc.

It should apply to sticks, bones, and blaze rods, but nothing else or you risk it jeopardizing the uniqueness of foxes. Also, dogs should sometimes bury those items in the ground, the block they buried it in (only dirt, sand, gravel and grass) would drop that item when broken. They should not use tools to fight or break blocks because dogs don't do that.
YES PLEASE!!! Skeletons suck in Bedrock and just shoot more arrows the closer you are to them. As a Java veteran, I'd really love for skeletons to get a brain on Bedrock.
That's what i want too long time ago, so it would be more challenging (along with bow charging animation)
Yes please I want to see the new skeleton ai in bedrock, how could 4J studios add that piraty on console edition and mojang not able to for so long

The bedrock issue is that the skeleton reloads its bow too quickly. And in the Java edition, the skeleton takes a time to reload and then shoot (also in the Java edition, the skeleton runs towards the player when it runs). I believe that Java skeleton AI is better than Bedrock, but its reload time is longer.

Hostile mobs were something left out of Update Aquatic, so heck yes! I think they should be larger than their real life counterparts though. It'd be more scary to people who are freaked out by crabs in general! 🤣

The crabs could deal damage using their claws and legs. Also, in real life, giant spider crabs would gather in large congregations in the full moon to moult, which is the time when they are the weakest. This would be cool to add in the Minecraft oceans, and would boost the moon cycles usefulness.
What if they are able to grab and destroy blocks such as gravel, kelp, seaweed and sand a bit like endermans? Would make living hear more challenging.
